tests.name: You ran npm init and it created package.json
You set the license during npm init to match the license in the LICENSE file
You used npm to install Bulma
You did not edit the custom CSS file
You linked Bulma in index.html
tests.run: cat index.html | egrep -o '.*href="(./)?node_modules/bulma/css/bulma.css".*' && NBUL=$(cat index.html | egrep -o '.*href="(./)?node_modules/bulma/css/bulma.css".*' | wc -l) && if [ "$NBUL" -eq "1" ]; then echo "TRUE"; fi

tests.name: You did not add any other lines to index.html
tests.run: NLIN=$(cat index.html | wc -l) && if [ "$NLIN" -eq "230" ]; then echo "TRUE"; fi

tests.name: Bulma class: button is-dark
tests.run: NBID=$(cat index.html | grep -o '.*class="button is-dark".*' | wc -l) && if [ "$NBID" -eq "2" ]; then echo "TRUE"; fi

tests.name: Bulma class: checkbox
tests.run: NCB=$(cat index.html | grep -o '.*class="checkbox".*' | wc -l) && if [ "$NCB" -eq "1" ]; then echo "TRUE"; fi

tests.name: Bulma class: column
tests.run: NCOL=$(cat index.html | grep -o '.*class="column".*' | wc -l) && if [ "$NCOL" -eq "8" ]; then echo "TRUE"; fi
